definition: Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
eight/8
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
(bound form) army/military

sentences.english: When the 8 armies come into China, the Russian army occupied the Kaiping province.
sentences.chinese: 八国联军进入中国时，沙俄军队占领了开平煤矿。

sentences.english: The rebellion failed, however, when Western powers intervened and stopped the revolt.
sentences.chinese: 八国联军溃败，西方势力调停并结束了这场叛乱。

sentences.english: A second series of destruction followed when eight allied armies put down the Boxer Movement in 1900.
sentences.chinese: 第二次浩劫是1900年的八国联军镇压义和团运动。

definition: the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
the crisis year of 1900 involving the Boxer uprising and the eight nation military invasion
Boxer Rebellion
invading army
Boxer Protocol of 1901 signed in Beijing, ending the Eight-power Allied Force intervention after the Boxer uprising
Qing government (1644-1911)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)
Yuanmingyuan, the Old Summer Palace, destroyed by the British and French army in 1860
Waldersee (name)/Alfred Graf Von Waldersee (1832-1904), commander-in-chief of the Eight-Nation Alliance 八國聯軍|八国联军[Ba1 guo2 Lian2 jun1]
Great Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
the Opium Wars of 1840-1842 and 1860-1861
Taku Forts, maritime defense works in Tianjin dating back to the Ming dynasty, playing a prominent role during the Opium Wars (1839-1860)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
the Qing court (as government of China)
